Package gg.w6.chesslib.model

Class CastlingRights

java.lang.Object
gg.w6.chesslib.model.CastlingRights
@Immutable public class CastlingRights extends Object
Represents the castling rights of both players in a chess game.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    CastlingRights()
    Constructs a new CastlingRights object with all rights enabled.

    Constructs a new CastlingRights object with the specified rights.

  • Constructor Details

    • CastlingRights

      public CastlingRights()
      Constructs a new CastlingRights object with all rights enabled.

    • CastlingRights

      public CastlingRights(boolean allRights)
      Constructs a new CastlingRights object with the specified rights.
      Parameters:
      allRights - True if all castling rights are enabled, false otherwise.

    • CastlingRights

      public CastlingRights(boolean whiteKingside, boolean whiteQueenside, boolean blackKingside, boolean blackQueenside)
      Constructs a new CastlingRights object with the specified rights.
      Parameters:
      whiteKingside - True if the white player can castle kingside, false otherwise.
      whiteQueenside - True if the white player can castle queenside, false otherwise.
      blackKingside - True if the black player can castle kingside, false otherwise.
      blackQueenside - True if the black player can castle queenside, false otherwise.

  • Method Details

    • whiteKingside

      public boolean whiteKingside()
      Returns:
      true if white still has the right to castle kingside

    • whiteQueenside

      public boolean whiteQueenside()
      Returns:
      true if white still has the right to castle queenside

    • blackKingside

      public boolean blackKingside()
      Returns:
      true if black still has the right to castle kingside

    • blackQueenside

      public boolean blackQueenside()
      Returns:
      true if black still has the right to castle queenside

    • allRightFalse

      public boolean allRightFalse()
      Determine there are no castling rights.

      Semantically equivalent to:

      
     !whiteKingside()
     && !whiteQueenside()
     && !blackKingside()
     && !blackQueenside()
      Returns:
      true if there are no castling rights.

    • equals

      public boolean equals(Object obj)
      Determine if this is equivalent to another object.
      Overrides:
      equals in class Object
      Parameters:
      obj - the object with which to compare against
      Returns:
      true if the other object is a CastlingRights object and all rights are equivalent
